decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers. By disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Thought Erasure and Extinction Event, while also generating card advantage and value with Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Nissa, Who Shakes the World, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents in the long game. Shark Typhoon provides an alternate win condition, creating a constant stream of flying threats. This deck excels at grinding out incremental advantages and overwhelming opponents with card advantage and board control.

The main focus of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to quickly establish board presence and control through sacrifice and stealing opponent's creatures. Utilizing cards like Claim the Firstborn and Village Rites, along with creatures like Woe Strider and Priest of Forgotten Gods, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent while generating value from sacrificing creatures. Mayhem Devil provides additional reach and damage, while Rankle, Master of Pranks disrupts the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and resource management.

The main concept of the deck is to play aggressively by utilizing sacrifice effects and efficient creatures to control the board and put pressure on the opponent. The deck focuses on using cards like Claim the Firstborn and Village Rites to steal and sacrifice the opponent's creatures, while also synergizing with cards like Mayhem Devil to deal additional damage. Cards like Priest of Forgotten Gods and Woe Strider help generate value through sacrificing creatures, while finishers like Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger and Rankle, Master of Pranks can help seal the deal and close out the game quickly.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy utilizing creatures with powerful abilities and pump effects. By quickly building a board presence and using cards like Primal Might and Garruk's Harbinger for removal and additional damage, the deck aims to finish off the opponent before they can stabilize. Additionally, cards like The Great Henge and Bonders' Enclave provide card draw and extra resources to keep the pressure on. With a strong emphasis on creatures and combat, this Mono Green Aggro deck looks to win the game through sheer force and efficiency.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Adventure mechanic to generate card advantage and apply pressure on the opponent by casting powerful creatures and spells. By leveraging cards like Lucky Clover and Edgewall Innkeeper, the deck aims to double up on the value of Adventure cards such as Beanstalk Giant and Lovestruck Beast. Additionally, Fae of Wishes provides flexibility by granting access to a sideboard filled with versatile cards to handle various situations. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with efficient creatures and versatile spells while maintaining a consistent tempo.

This Sultai Control deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan with various removal spells like Heartless Act and Eliminate, as well as disrupting their hand with cards like Thought Erasure. The deck also includes powerful threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Hydroid Krasis for card advantage and board presence. The inclusion of Casualties of War allows you to deal with multiple threats at once, while planeswalkers like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Tamiyo, Collector of Tales provide additional card advantage and control over the game.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing a powerful board presence with aggressive creatures and then using Winota, Joiner of Forces to capitalize on the attacking creatures by cheating out even more powerful threats from its library. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of attacks and trigger Winota's ability multiple times in a single turn, dealing massive damage and securing a swift victory. The deck combines efficient creatures with powerful synergies to create a fast-paced and formidable aggro strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Narset and Nissa, along with versatile removal spells like Extinction Event and Eliminate. The deck also focuses on generating card advantage and tempo with cards like Uro and Hydroid Krasis. With a mix of counterspells, hand disruption, and big threats, this Sultai Control deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver its opponents while maintaining control of the board throughout the game.

The deck is focused on aggressive gameplay utilizing cycling cards to control the board and apply pressure to the opponent. By cycling through cards, the deck can trigger abilities like Zenith Flare to deal damage and gain advantage. It also includes cards like Footfall Crater and Drannith Stinger to maintain board presence and protect important creatures. The goal is to quickly build a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent with efficient cycling and aggressive creatures.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly establish board presence and apply pressure on the opponent using a combination of efficient creatures and powerful adventure cards. By utilizing cards like Lucky Clover and Edgewall Innkeeper to generate extra value, alongside versatile threats like Lovestruck Beast and Brazen Borrower, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. Additionally, the inclusion of Fae of Wishes provides access to a wide range of sideboard options, allowing for adaptability in different matchups. Overall, this deck prioritizes speed and aggression to secure victories in Standard 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck focuses on utilizing adventure creatures and Lucky Clover to generate value and tempo advantage. By consistently casting adventure spells with the help of Lucky Clover, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with an aggressive playstyle. It also includes powerful spells like Escape to the Wilds for card advantage and disruption in the form of counterspells like Negate and Aether Gust. The mana base is designed to support a consistent curve and the inclusion of versatile giants like Beanstalk Giant for added flexibility in gameplay.

This deck focuses on maintaining early board presence through aggressive plays with low-cost creatures like Gutterbones and Lazotep Reaver, while utilizing sacrifice mechanics with cards like Priest of Forgotten Gods and Mayhem Devil. Combining these synergies with cards like Whisper Squad and Woe Strider allows for constant pressure on the opponent's resources. Claim the Firstborn is used for control and disruption, while Village Rites and Castle Locthwain provide card advantage. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently, utilizing the power of the Rakdos color combination.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy with a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption. It aims to control the game until it can establish a strong board presence with powerful threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Hydroid Krasis. Nissa, Who Shakes the World provides ramp and additional threats, while Shark Typhoon can create additional blockers and flying threats. By controlling the game and out-valuing the opponent, this deck aims to grind out a victory in the mid to late game.

The focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient creatures and powerful spells. By utilizing a mono green strategy, this aggro deck aims to quickly build a board presence and apply pressure on the opponent. With a combination of mana acceleration from cards like Castle Garenbrig and Nissa, Who Shakes the World, along with versatile removal spells like Primal Might, this deck is designed to seize control of the game early and maintain a steady stream of threats to close out the match swiftly.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient creatures that have built-in advantages such as trample and card draw. By leveraging the power of cards like Vivien, Arkbow Ranger and Questing Beast, supplemented by removal spells like Primal Might, the deck aims to quickly build a strong board presence and maintain pressure on the opponent. With a focus on efficient mana usage and a low curve, the deck can consistently put pressure on the opponent and close out games quickly.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly build a strong board presence through efficient and aggressive creatures like Barkhide Troll, Lovestruck Beast, and Pelt Collector, while utilizing cards like Scavenging Ooze and Stonecoil Serpent for flexibility and resilience. Vivien, Arkbow Ranger and Garruk's Harbinger provide additional support and card advantage. The overall strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and powerful creatures, backed up by removal and combat tricks like Primal Might. The mana base is designed to ensure consistent access to green mana for casting creatures and spells.
